Reviews.Title: “Good stay with F&F rate, met expectation. 401 noise”
Reviews.Author: JerryHung
Reviews.Content: I'm a Club Carlson Silver Elite (free upgrade if available) + Room (2 Queen) is bigger than I thought + If you know Carlson employee, you get great F&F rate + Good location (401 & Victoria Park), close to 401 and 404, IKEA + 2 free water bottles + Parking is only $4 (via eUpgrae offer), instead of regular $9 + Free Internet (given access code by receiption) + Sleep Number bed was..interesting...to adjust firmness. 1 bed's control doesn't show any # though but 1 - Didn't get upgraded at all (room 920, top floor), not sure if it's there's no 2-bed suite?? - Too close to 401 (I'm 2 rooms away from the edge of 401) and noise is loud overnight - Little stain on the bathroom floor towel Overall, good prompt service for a quick standard stay close to Toronto Zoo Met my average expectation but not above and beyond for CC Silver (soon Gold) member :(

Reviews.Title: “for the price this is a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cuty c
Reviews.Content: For the price, I was impressed, the service was great, the rooms were clean, nice little gym and pool in the hotel and breakfast was included in the price, it was really good!

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired but adequate”
Reviews.Author: jamesmorton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit tired. The bathrooms especially are clean but need a renovation. The bar/restuarant is quite weak -- limited selection and not very good. The price is high for what you get. There's a Days Inn just around the corner which is just as good and maybe $50/night cheaper. Overall ok but nothing amazing.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: peyman88
Reviews.Content: hey i stayed here at end of january for one night. the location is A+ I booked thru hotwire so i got an amazing rate. the service was excellent, check in was very quick the room were dissent in terms of size the room was alit bit too hot, but if you turn off the heat, it will get OK as time goes on. lots of fast food and restaurants around it. overall very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stay only if you have to!!!”
Reviews.Author: mia155032
Reviews.Content: I stayed because of the area. close to what i needed , but for the price I have stayed in much better hotels..

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled by the pictures”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFeet
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on booking.com with my visa card. Although I had all my information of my visa card to book a room I didnt have my physical card on me because I misplace it. I felt it would be a problem when I get there so I called the front desk to Radisson and the monotone person said that when I get here I can pay in any form of payment and it would not be a problem. Here is when the problems started happening.I asked for a name so that if there was any problems I would at least have the name of who I was talking to BUT he didn't want to give it to me. He just said "uh...just come to the front and we will help you" "yes but I would like your name just in case I have a problem". This went on for a while in 2 different phone conversations and I simply hung up. Me and my boyfriend decided to come in separately so when I got there and told them that I didn't have my card they told me they could not let me in the room and so I waited. Once my Boyfriend got there the dispute started happening. I explained them that I spoke to someone over the phone (who wouldn't give me there name) that it was okay if we didn't have the visa card but to pay on a different form. They said they couldn't do anything. And the guy MOCKED me saying in a smug voice "Our associates would never decline to give out there name". Well buddy they did so you should re-train them because you obviously didn't do a good job. Seeing that I was very upset and angry they called us back to the front and said they will give us the room. I feel like that they were afraid of the bad review we might give them from booking.com. The Room The hallways smell and the room was stuffy and the washroom was NOT clean. The ice machine was not working on our floor so we had to get ice from 2 floors down. It doesn't stop there it gets better. They changed the clock an hour ahead on us so when we did wake up to the alarm clock we noticed it was different on our phone. You want your guest to leave that bad? Why don't you just change your bloody check out time. The cleaning lady that came and opened our door without knocking twice!!! the first time my boyfriend said we're leaving at 11 on the dot and she said "ok" and came back an hour later when I was half naked saying sorry sorry. Never again. Really never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mottib
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect for those whoe wish to travel to Toronto East,Thorn Hill ,Voughn & elsewhere as well. Located on tow main highways:401 East to West & 404 South to North. The rooms are large & comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: banb
Reviews.Content: This was a "mystery" booking through Hotwire and the rate wasn't that special. The location was convenient for my needs but it felt very isolated in a business park. The parking fee wasn't that expensive but I don't believe this location warrants a fee at all, at least not for guests. There was no free wifi in the room, just free internet via plug in. Wifi and computer could be accessed in the lobby. Bad smells were everywhere! There seemed to be a lot of smokers around which brought their stench into elevators and through the vents into the room. I was met with an overpowering, constant smell of deodorizer in the lobby. My room initially smelled of mothballs. The real kicker was the unbearable heat in the room. After several hours of no temperature change, the front desk said they just installed a new heating system and it "takes time". When I told them it had already been several hours, they offered a portable fan and suggested I open the window. Facing the highway, the noise was too much to keep the window open all night. The room was very dated (old TV, phone, clockradio, doors) and showed signs of water damage and misuse. It was spacious and the bed was comfortable but I really felt the need to check the sheets in the this place! I agree with the comments in other reviews but I think they were too generous in their ratings.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Expecting More from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kian1
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is fairly spacious, but also dated. Free internet a definite plus. The bathroom/shower needed renovation, and there was an old CRT TV in the hotel room, so I could not connect my laptop to it. I have not seen these old TVs in hotels of this calibre for quite some time now. The heater/AC unit was very loud (as was the shower in the room above) and had to be shut off at night so we could sleep. Tried opening the small window for fresh air and some natural cooling, but then we had the loud humming sound of the highway to deal with. There was a sign in the elevator indicating if your stay is not a 10 out of 10, we want to hear about it, but nowhere in the hotel room or front desk did I find a feedback card, making it rather difficult to provide feedback. Given the choice, I would pass up this hotel next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special!”
Reviews.Author: bonlou30
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I got this hotel after bidding on Priceline. It is in an office area and is looking very tired. The smoking smell in the elevator got me each time I entered to go up to my room. The room is very spacious which I appreciated but I hope I don't have to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Laurinska
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since the hotel has had updates, but I found the staff were very friendly. Their business centre was useful. I had a "sleep number" bed and the remote didn't work well. The past guest had set the bed to rock hard and only after struggling with the remote for about 30 minutes, was I able to set it to my liking. The rooms were tidy. I had a desk so I was able to work in the evenings. Wireless was touch and go. When I discovered I forgot my hair brush, the front desk didn't have anything on hand (as many other hotels do) which was disappointing. The breakfast in the morning was good and pretty quick. I stayed here due to the proximity to my office; but I'll likely stay somewhere else the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great...”
Reviews.Author: Louis514
Reviews.Content: I spent just one night on business. The room was clean but could certainly benefit from some updating and renovations. Wi-fi is only available in the lobby while rooms only have wired connections. Bed is hard (and the remote controller wasn't working). Hotel is very close to highway 401 but the noise from it isn't too bad. This hotel will remain a 4th-5th choice if other nicer places at comparable prices are all booked.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again if the price was right, but not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: Murdochsroomate
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for a few days when my hotel of choice was charging substantially higher rates. On the plus side, the room I got for my $100 or so was HUGE. ...a suite, really. It was also generally clean and in a good state of repair. And I didn't have any problems with the adjustable mattresses. I appreciated being able to control the softness. On the downside, there were, what appeared to be massive blood stains all over the carpet near the vanity by the washroom...so I wore sandals any time I went near that part of the suite. it was pretty gross, but since the suite was so huge and the affected space was so small by comparison, it didn't bother me as much as if I were in a normal sized hotel room. Also on the plus side, I found the staff to be quite friendly and helpful for the most part. All in all, I'd probably stay here again if I needed a good rate and they were offering it. There are nicer hotels near the airport, though.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: lisaspecht
Reviews.Content: This isn't a great hotel. This isn't a bad hotel. It's really just a place to sleep if you're in that part of Toronto. I stayed two nights on business, and was unimpressed. The beds are "Sleep Number" models, which might have been exciting if the settings didn't randomly change on their own in my bed, and if my room mate's bed even HAD a controller. There was no remote for the TV, even after the desk staff were told about this. The chair at the desk had no back support. I leaned back and felt like I was going to go right over backwards! It was more of a recliner than a desk chair! I was going to have a hot bath upon arrival, but one look at the tub totally changed my mind! The bottom of the tub was chipped, and very rough, like other damage had been patched over with something. The lighting in the bathroom was very dim, there was stronger lights over the tub than over the mirror! We had the breakfast buffet both mornings, and again, it was just so so. The toaster took forever to even lightly brown the bread, and on the second day, ALL of the food was cold! Bacon, potatoes, sausage, eggs, all cold! All of these things are really pretty minor if you just need a place to sleep. The hotel is clean enough, and the staff I encountered were pleasant enough. There are lots of hotels that are way better in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - no frills”
Reviews.Author: Northernfly
Reviews.Content: spent two evenings at this hotel - cab drivers have a hard time to find it and it's far enough away from many things. Rooms are tired and could use some updating, beds are hard, phone in room didn't work, internet was on/off , carpet in room was not clean. Breakfast at their restaurant is buffet and was cold - expensive. Don't bother. Don't think I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lerrilynn
Reviews.Content: We gambled and booked through hotwire and were pleasanty surprised.Our room on the 7th floor was very comfortable and quiet, nicely decorated( sleep number beds were a nice touch) and it had a nice view of the cityscape. The kids loved the pool. Very convenient location near the Don valley parkway and the 401. Restaurants, grocery store etc were within a block. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Baddfeccc
Reviews.Content: I never agree with those who rate hotels poorly because they got stuck beside the elevator or had rowdy teenagers beside them because sometimes you have to take the good with the bad. Upon arrival the hotel seemed nice and we got a decent price on Expedia so didn't have grand expectations. Check-in staff was friendly and the kids were excited about the pool. There was a $8 parking charge which seemed strange so far form downtown but still not a big deal. Upon entering the room it seemed modern and recently upgraded but with further inspection the bathroom was grimy particularly on the tub area and the room in general was dirty. There was wrappers and food under the beds and the recepticals where the phone and lamp plug into were hanging off the wall with exposed wires. We found the beds were "Sleep Number" beds which at first seemed to be a novelty, but in the morning found they were extremely uncomfortable even at the recommended setting. In the morning we found when turning on the shower the drain was stuck closed and even when pryed open with a coat hanger the water drained so slowly it was at my wife's knees by the time she was done. The rest of us had to shower in the pool change room. Upon checkout we expressed our displeasure with the room and our stay in general and the front desk clerk said it was too bad and we should have said something earlier but how could we know the beds were terrible and the shower didn't work until the morning. I wouldn't stay here again regardless of the price I got.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and near the highway”
Reviews.Author: Blizzardave
Reviews.Content: This place is deadly convenient for the traveller. It's right next to the TransCanada highway and very close to the DVP/404. It's not the most upscale place in the world but, hey, it's good value for the money. The in-house restaurant specialises in a breakfast buffet that's pretty basic but reasonably-priced. There are at least 6 or 7 restaurants within relatively easy walking distance. There are a couple of drawbacks to the hotel. Firstly, it's smack in the middle of suburbia so there's not a lot to do in the immediate vicinity. This hotel is clearly designed for the automobile-endowed traveller. Secondly, what passes for a view from the window is that of the 401 highway. The hotel is fairly well soundproofed so the highway noise is tolerable. If you're travelling on a budget and don't mind driving wherever you want to go, give the Radisson East a go. You might be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: geedee7
Reviews.Content: The room I had was a twin queen, not a bad size. It's showing its age... generally well maintained but carpet stains really do ruin the ambience! Bog standard hotel room really, with nothing to set it apart from the bland blend boxes they all are these days. No fridge. Two cups of coffee (one decaf.) Some gimmick with the beds (compressed air to adjust firmness) but mine didn't work. The BIG issue.... I was told on the phone, when booking, that all rooms had internet included. Maybe it's my own fault, but I assumed that, in 2011, that would be wi-fi. No. Cable only. If you want wi-fi, go to the lobby. If you have a tablet or a smartphone, forget about emailing from the room (unless you have 3G). That's a bit of a let down. Even the cheapest motels have caught on to wi-fi! In summary, it's not what I expected from a Radisson. It could have been any old 3* hotel. On a positive side, for those who still smoke, they do have smoking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We liked our upgraded room and will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Marie H
Reviews.Content: We booked the Radisson east for 10 days because it was the closest hotel to our parent's home. We were somewhat apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the negative reviews so when we checked in, we were relieved that we were upgraded to one of the executive rooms on the top floor. The kids enjoyed adjusting the bed's softness and the linens and beds were fine. We had a mini fridge in our room which was handy to store our water. Our hotel room faced the 401 so the traffic noise disrupted our sleep somewhat. Luckily a pair of earplugs solved this problem. The staff was helpful and friendly. I used the fitness centre 3 times and was pleasantly surprised. It was adjacent to the pool and had large windows. There were 2 treadmills and 2 stairmasters. Unfortunately the weight machine was broken at that time. Our towels were missing one day and we had a set of towels missing for 2 days, however, this was rectified immediately when we phone the front desk. Overall it was good value for the price and we would stay in the executive room again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Chantal G
Reviews.Content: The Service was beyond Excellent.. We stayed 3 nights and ate in the Restaurant all 3 mornings. Breakfast for 4 was a wee bit expensive but the food was great and filled us up for most of the day. Kids chose the Pancakes or French Toast. While my husband and I chose the Buffet ( Oatmeal/Cereal, Variety of Juices/Milk, Fruits, Scrambled Eggs, Potatoes, Bacon/Sausage, and Assorted Bread). The staff always made a point of coming to our table to chit chat with us about our day and plans, offering advice if needed. The Room was spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. Internet was available in the room (no wi-fi) and very quick. Bathroom was clean and refreshed everyday. Towels were clean and almost looked brand new. The location is a bit out of the way with nothing much around the hotel. For us the location was centered around all the activities we had planned making it great for us. They do charge $8.00 a night for parking. The pool was a treat for the kids, with hotter than average water. There was no towels upon arriving but asked the front desk staff and within minutes someone arrived with a handful of them. We stayed on the second floor and actually went on an Ice Hunt to find an Ice Cube Machine that worked. Second floor was broken, Third floor was broken, got on the elevator with another couple that brought us to the eight floor but that one was broken as well. Found some on the Seventh Floor. Quite the adventure... Overall for the price we paid (we booked through Hotwire) the hotel was great for what we needed. Would stay here again if given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mamajga
Reviews.Content: We got a discounted rate from an on-line discount company, so I am rating our experience based on what we paid. I believe the cost would be double if booked directly with the hotel, which then I would say it is over priced. Very pleasant place to stay. Clean, well taken care of pool area, with warmer than average water. Kids loved it! No hot tub or sauna, but that was fine with us. We had a room with a view of the highway, the kids enjoyed watching all the cars. You can adjust the beds and make them harder or softer.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: EmilyNYC_5
Reviews.Content: This was booked by our tour group so I can't really say if it was a good value for the money but I can say that we finally had a good nights sleep after staying at a bad hotel in Montreal. I was very disappointed that it was far from the city so we just ended up resting that night. The room was spacious and the king bed was comfortable. We also were happy to see that the room had a fridge. The hotel had a small pool that we didn't get to try out. Wi-Fi only worked in the lobby, wish it worked up in the rooms as well. It was disappointing that the breakfast that they were providing for our group was late and wasn't much. But at least we got a good night's sleep that we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Needs work”
Reviews.Author: Bombero2556
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in serious need of upgrading. To begin with the room had a strange odor that did not go away during our 3 day stay. In addition the ac barely worked even though we lowered the thermostat down to 50 degrees. This was true of the entire hotel so changing rooms was a waste of time. The ice machine was broken on our floor as well as the floor below and the floor above. I ended up going to the 5th floor for ice. It was a dead giveaway that this hotel hadn't been renovated in a long time because there were still ashtrays at the elevators and the carpet was very worn there as well. The bathroom had a steel tub with porcelain chipped around the drain and in the middle of the tub with rust stains in these areas. If you aren't fussy about decor then this hotel is fine. One last thing, they charge for parking which when you figure you're paying good money for the room should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price Reasonable Quality”
Reviews.Author: vikrambhatnagar
Reviews.Content: The Beds were interesting as they had a hardness level selector. It was a little inconvenient as well as a little fun. Kids did not care for this feature. Room service was slow and inadequate. The rooms had menus with delivery. So that was the saving grace. Location and cleanliness was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: zingmaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. I'd booked the room through an online site and good a really good rate, otherwise I would have been very disappointed. Checked in and asked for a quiet room but was given a room by the elevator and across from the ice machine. The keys didn't work so back downstairs to complain about the room location and the keys. This time got assistance from a different clerk who was very helpful in putting us into a quiet room at the end of the hall. Upstairs we go again and keys don't work in this room. Over 5 nights this happened 4 times. Finally someone explained that the locks get old and have to be replaced from time to time and this was done. Prior to that explanation I was being told that the key was too close my cell phone or wallet, etc. The rooms are dated. Old TV and shower. The bed was very comfortable and we slept great especially being at the end of the hall. The fitness room was better than expected after reviewing other comments. The treadmill worked fine and the weight machine was pretty good. We stayed here because of the location which was convenient for us and would only stay again if we got a heck of a deal. Most of the hotels in this area seem to get poor reviews so not a lot of choice unless you go downtown or near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vibrant45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night enroute on a road trip. In general the room was old and worn, but that's not the bad part. Sheets were torn. Towels were dirty - we had to ask for new clean ones. The showerhead in bathroom literally came out of the wall. Not a pleasant experience of what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: tadak
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for one night while our house was being painted. Got a great deal on priceline.com ($69/night) for a room with 2 queen beds. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. While there is absolutely nothing to do or see in the direct vicinity of the hotel (and the area is actually a depressing sprawl of office buildings, industry and congested traffic), it is right on the 401 and close to the DVP, so all Toronto area attractions are quite accessible. There are some very good ethnic restaurants within a 5-10 minute drive from the hotel. Sashimi House and Alara (great Turkish pizza place) are right at Consumers rd & Sheppard (5 mins), and there is a great dim sum place at Victoria Park and Tempo (7-8 mins). Really can't beat the priceline deal for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, very comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Balzacian
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family for a 100th birthday celebration. The hotel proximity to the 401 highway was exceptional. Access to the museum, science centre and Lake Ontario beach area were easy and quick. We were away from the downtown core but close to everything. Our room had 2 queen beds with exceptional comfort and clean, crisp linens and comforters. Pillows were like clouds. There was plenty of space in the room for the 3 of us to move around. A large desk and table and a lounge chair with foot rest were well used by us. Bathroom was always clean. The 7th floor room faced downtown and we could see the CN Tower and all around the city. A quick drive from the hotel and there are lots of small ethnic restaurants that offer anything you can imagine. Across the street is Tim Hortons and Wendys. There is also a great pub called the Queens Head. It has friendly, helpful staff, yummy food that is very well priced and also serves a large $4.99 breakfast starting at 7:00 am. Skip the fast food and go there. We would stay there again without hesitation. We paid $86 per night for 3 people. Parking was free.

Reviews.Title: “For Price -Very Pleased. Solid 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: DutchCanuck58
Reviews.Content: When I read some of these other reviews I have to wonder what hotel they stayed at. I paid under 100 bucks and in Toronto with only a 7 dollar parking fee....a very good value. Rooms were comfortable and clean. My son is in a wheelchair and the regular room was MORE than adequate when it came to accessibility. The beds were very comfortable, with lots of pillows (8). Free Wi-Fi, bottled water and very nice coffee were all included. Check in was very fast and the staff friendly. I canâ€™t even say anything negative because there was nothing. I did not try the restaurant or bar and did not get into the pool. Anyone staying here expecting a solid 3 star will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “If it weren't so close to the office, I'd never stay there. But it is.”
Reviews.Author: abgwin
Reviews.Content: My company's head office is a few blocks away, so I stay here whenever I'm in Toronto. But I wish it wasn't. I've stayed there maybe 5 times in the last year, and the same problems happen every time. The toilets don't flush well. The hot water can be sporadic. The billing system just sometimes adds on charges (they're ALWAYS very good about reversing them, but why does it even happen?). The restaurant isn't very good, but the service is at least good. The cleaning staff does a great job, but the rooms are so in need of a remodel or refresh that there's only so much they can do. I'm not a fan of SelectComfort beds, since the ones here sometimes won't adjust. There are frequent large bus and/or tour groups staying here, which can make getting in or out a challenge at times. It's not a terrible hotel, but it's not very good either.

Reviews.Title: “Close to 401, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: feedthetraveller
Reviews.Content: Reason for stars: I hosted a meeting here and needed to be close the 401. The facility was not all that clean but it served my purpose. We got a large suite in the hotel and it was fair but again, nothing special. If you can get it for a great price, great. If you want bang for your buck, keep on looking. Rooms: Fair. Location: Close to 401. Value: Fair

Reviews.Title: “1 minute from highway 401 " on ramp "”
Reviews.Author: bettson
Reviews.Content: Hotwire ? Great value, but . . . BIG error ! 93 year old Mum, husband & wife, sharing a "Handicapped " room - Hotwire did not mention . . . The Raddison Hotel had ONLY king beds ! ! ! They switched us & upgraded us ( slightly,) but the 93 year old had to shower in the basement ( no access !!! ) swimming pool area ! I carried her walker down 8 steps . . . she clung to the railing - showered & went back to our room - damp !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Solid 3 Star.”
Reviews.Author: Michelyn
Reviews.Content: Hello. My husband and I had to stay in Toronto this past weekend for a wedding. We have always had good luck using Priceline, so after deciding on the North Toronto area for our choice location we bid $75 per night for 3 nights and we received the Radisson Toronto East. After reading the other reviews I was VERY nervous and upon pulling up to the hotel and its dated exterior I became even more nervous. But once inside the lobby I felt better. The staff was extremely friendly and quick, within minutes we were checked in and on our way to room 902. From reading other Tripadvisor reviews I was aware that the 8th and 9th floors were the "Executive Levels" that had been more recently remodled than the rest of the hotel. On our way up to the 9th floor, the elevator stopped at 7 and even the carpet on that floor looked disgusting, but thats all I can comment on. Our room was nice, albeit small, but clean. We had a king size bed, flat screen tv, desk and chair etc. The room also had a coffee maker and a fridge. The Radisson hotels are equipped with sleep number beds which is a neat feature. Unfortunately the bed did not work. The last Radisson we stayed at in Kitchener had a working bed, but this one did not. My husband found the bed to be much too hard for his liking. The bathroom was very small. The floor would get soaked when you had a shower but the counter top was solid surface and the bathroom was clean enough. There was no exhaust fan and the lighting was terrible. But there was a hairdryer. So overall it was just good. We stayed for 3 nights and we never used the maid service, we just asked for more towels which we receievd promptly. Parking here was good at $7/night - that is the area average. The fitness centre was very limited, but for cardio it does the job. The easy access to the 401 and the DVP was perfect. For the $75 priceline rate I am happy - if I would have paid the $150/night advertised price for the executive level I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY!”
Reviews.Author: Cyberia0083
Reviews.Content: I have to change my room TWICE! The bathroom is so dirty that I can still see the solid around the bowl! Carpet small! And when I ask for room change, the gentleman at the front desk response with such PROFESSIONAL CLAIMNESS that I thought I was talking to a robot.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: flyguy35
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while on business. I would discribe this hotel as being very average. The hall ways and common areas are showing there age and could use a little updating. The room itself was ok but you can see where the room had renos done over time but not at the same time. As you can see from the mixed reviews here, I cannot recommend or discount this hotel. If you do decide to stay here, just do not go in with high expectations and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “1st choice hotel for North York!!!”
Reviews.Author: torontolady1988
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip. I dont know why so many complaints. Check-in took no more than 5 minutes Big clean room and bathroom.Big Comfy Bed. Did not have a problem with pet dander like other guest reviews?? The outside of the hotel is nothing special but I could care less about the outside all I care for is the room. Is a great price in comparison to other North York hotels and much better value. Each room has a frigde was was great since most hotels charge extra for that. Parking was ONLY $7. The Yorkalnd is beautiful but overpriced (since they changed owners)and their breakfast SUCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting and grotesque establishment”
Reviews.Author: tpain55
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. This would probably be the most disgusting and vile of places you could take a family. Had to wait 30+ minutes to check in due to cleaning. This is a pet hotel which became evident from the dog hair covering the bed sheets and not to mention the stench of urine. When we had spoken to the manager the guy had no answer for the bed sheets and neither an aplogy nor action was taken upon this issue. It is very clear that this hotel cuts corners in it's staff and cleanliness. Expect to get a horrid room with no customer service or appreciation.Ironically the hotel had a sign which read 100% customer satisfaction which in no way reflects the staff and owners true feelings and only that of the Raddison name. Stay away from this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute booking but cant complain”
Reviews.Author: T-dott
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms @ this hotel for the run-off of guests from a wedding. This was a long weekend and essentially everything else closer in proximity to the venue was booked. The rooms are clean and decent with a large work space area also provided. The hotel is located right beside two major road arteries so accessing the city core or else where is simple. Guests are charged for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Average 3-Star”
Reviews.Author: trevorrmartin
Reviews.Content: We are currently halfway through our 3 night stay at this hotel. Check in was smooth, no complaints about staff at all. Lobby area is very clean and welcoming. There are also two free computer w which workstations in the lobby which allow you to print to the front desk for free. Location is in a business park right off the 401, easy to access and several restaurants and shops nearby. There is ample parking although they do charge $7/night, not sure why but it seems to be the norm in the GTA for all 3 or 4 star hotels to charge something for parking. We checked into our room on the 5th floor upon arriving and I was back at the front desk within minutes. It appeared clean and fairly spacious but when the air turned on it sounded like a paint can shaker was trapped in the vent. The front desk staff promptly moved us to another room on still on the 5th floor. Our crib was delivered within minutes of arrival as well as sheets were promptly sent up when requested. New room is clean, spacious and other than the very small bathroom no complaints. It is defintiely not a 4-star room but certainly fitting of a 3-star. High speed in the room is reliable and fast. One major complaint, hallways. From the 2nd to the 7th floor the hallway carpets are disgusting. There are stains everywhere. Ice machines also seem to be a common problem, currently not working from the 4th-6th floors (not sure about 3rd). Every time I walk in the hallway someone shows up with an ice bucket in search of a working machine and I send them up higher. (One little note: 8th and 9th floors which I am assuming are business floors have brand new carpets and ice machines...I find it a little insulting that all floors don't deserve the same.) Finally, the fitness center and pool area are very well done. The pool area has wall murals of palm trees and a brand new rubberized floor to prevent slipping. This was a very nice feature! The pool water was very cold even though it supposed to be heated and the hot tub is drained and not working. With a working hot tub and warmer pool area would be an overall plus compared to many other hotels. Fitness center is small but features a lot more equipment than many other 3-star hotels I've stayed at. All in all I would consider staying here again and I would classify the hotel as average, not great, but deserving of a 3-star nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Most disgusting, unnaceptable hotel stay I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: BellAbjessie
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very dirty, floors covered in stains. Pool was out of order although guests are not informed at time of check in. AC was not working although we were promised it would be fixed by Thursday night and Friday was still not working. Hotel has a "satisfaction gaurantee" although when manager was asked to refund our charges we were told "if I honor it for you, I'd have to do it for all of the guests that complain" wow

Reviews.Title: “BEST POSSIBLE SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: thai4006
Reviews.Content: The desk service at this hotel is the best I have ever experienced. ZUL (man on front desk) was the most patient and considerate hotel agent I have ever dealt with! When you're travelling you need that kind of attention and care. For these reasons I give this hotel a big thumbs up! (and a thank you too)

Reviews.Title: “A memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Joy73kolkata
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a month in Radisson Hotel Toronto East in the month of April to May , 2009 & found it very much comfortable. The hotel rooms were great with high speed internet connection. The breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of choice.The staffs were very courteous , even though there were no separate travel desk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwetaJain
Reviews.Content: Radisson is a nice hotel to stay, huge rooms and nice view. But the service is not tht good . front desk people are not responsive and good

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms, great buffet”
Reviews.Author: hokeydokey1
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Toronto from Halifax with my husband to attend a work function. The staff were very friendly and courteous. The room overall was clean and nice, the bathroom was outdated, but usable. My husband has returned to this hotel several times and has never had any issues with it. The sleep number beds were the worst part of the trip. Although my husband enjoyed his side of the bed, mine was cold and uncomfortable. My sleep number never stayed the same, and leaked air overnight. By morning, I was laying on the hard boxspring. I wish they would go back to traditional beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great indoor swimming pool...”
Reviews.Author: TugaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Great indoor swimming pool. Kids love it! The room is nice and clean with a great bed.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel for the price...needs some renovation”
Reviews.Author: qabacha
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline. Got a pretty good rate $47 + taxes and fees for each night. We had a decent stay, but I felt the hotel needed some renovation, especially the bathroom in the room. The sink was cracked, shower curtain rod was almost coming apart, the drains were slow, and the bathroom door kept locking up. The ice machines on 3 floors were broken and the room carpets need replacing. I liked the sleep number beds, linen was clean and the comforter was nice. The cleaning team forgot to make our beds one day even though they replaced the towels and cleaned the bathroom. I also do not see why they charge $7 for parking. The hotel is not in or near downtown where parking spaces are premium. The Wi-Fi network was absolutely unreliable. My computer kept dropping the connection while my phone could never connect over Wi-Fi. I know that in future I'll not select anything below 31/2 stars on Priceline even if I have to pay a little more for Name Your Price option.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: richardY
Reviews.Content: We hosted a New Years Eve party at the hotel for a small group of family and friends, total 60 people. The hotel did a fantastic job following our requests and instructions for the room. The food came on time and the service was excellent. The food was GREAT, everyone in the group loved the food...compliments to the chef! We were a bit concerned at first because there were 3 other functions at the hotel. We've heard horror stories of parties going out of control. But everything was very much under control, there were hotel managers roaming around all night and the hotel also had police officers patrolling the hotel. There was not a single incident all night. Most of us stayed overnight. The guest rooms were clean and comfortable. It was great to have 2 queen beds instead of just 2 double beds, which is what we have seen at many hotels. The rooms are very spacious. The kids even went for a swim the next day at the hotel's indoor swiming pool. And thanks to the front desk for letting us check out an hour later. Overall we had an awesome time at the hotel and we are already talking about booking again for 2010. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust staff”
Reviews.Author: cheekee
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was a great place for me since family was close by. It is a little bit far from the airport, but it was a good location for us. Check-in service was interesting. He just asked us for our car licence plate, and gave us the keys. It was upon check out when we signed the registration sheet. The room was nice, if you don't mind dirt. There was a piece of what looked like chicken wing bones on the carpet as we walked through the door. I kicked it aside, and didn't let it bother me. The next morning, I went out for lunch with my family to find my iPod Touch was stolen by the housekeepers. It's been a few weeks now where I've tried contacting the hotel and only to find I am getting nowhere. I was out of the room for only 45 minutes. She never took anything else I had lying around such as my eee pc, camera, tom tom and a bunch of other electronics. Upon check out, we left quite early. I should have suspected when the housekeeper asked me "which room?" and happily and speedily went to our room... probably to find more things for her to take. I've lost a lot of stuff on that iPod Touch that I will never get back. Cheap rate for cheap service. I don't give them credit just because they are a large chain hotel. Stay at the Hilton instead.. it's a little further, but a much more trusted brand. To make it worse, parking was $5/day... I'd understand if it was valet or downtown Toronto. This hotel makes no sense.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, bad service, noisy, unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: oceanpark66
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. I travel a lot for work and stay in many hotels. This has to be the worst experience I've ever had in a hotel. I stayed at this hotel for a week to get some work done and some peace and quiet (my house is being renovated). The hotel is supposed to be a 3.5, but the rooms are dingy and not being maintained (my lamp was burnt and falling apart, bathtub was chipped and stained) I had to move rooms three times because of problems. The first room had no heat and was freezing, and the hot water didn't work. The second room was very musty. The third room seemed okay until I opened the blinds, and I kid you not, to find a whole bunch of flies flying around trying to escape. The room also was too hot, and the air conditioning did not work. I was awoken early almost every morning by the front desk routing wrong numbers to my room, or wanting to ask me questions. I had a do not disturb sign on my door, yet the housekeepers would STILL knock early in the morning. Once, one of them even CALLED me (waking me up) to confirm that I did not want my room cleaned. I called the front desk asking how to make it clearer that I did not want to be disturbed, which resulted in them yelling at the maid who came to me in the hallway scared and saying she was going to get fired because of my complaint. It is unfair for the hotel to put a guest in this sort of situation where I just wanted to get some rest but in doing so threatened someone's livelihood. Not fair to me or the maid! On the final day, they called me twice insisting that my fire detector was a problem. In an effort to compensate my terrible stay, the guy at the front desk offered to refund a charge of about $25 for room service which had been made to my credit card. This would have been nice, except for the fact that I hadn't actually ordered any room service, and they were incorrectly billing me!!

Reviews.Title: “All about Excellent Customer Service - Consider it Done”
Reviews.Author: jeffandsueg
Reviews.Content: The motto of this hotel is "Consider it Done". The staff is absolutely excellent and go out of their way to make your stay simply excellent. I've been staying at this hotel for a few years now and look forward to being able to relax in the warm pool (nothing worse than a cold pool), excellent rooms, and very friendly staff. On Wed nights, they have a manager reception where the mgmt attends and welcomes each guest. Every morning, the coffee is waiting for me in the restaurant. At night, the service is nothing short of great and friendly. I've stayed at hotels all over north america and highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in toronto. You will be pleasantly surprised. Radisson, keep up the excellent work !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service! Would love to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: vphan21
Reviews.Content: Even this hotel is a bit far from downtown, this is such a nice place to stay in Toronto. rooms have wonderful views to the highway. Friendly staff. Excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: kortney~andrea
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient if you are driving as it is just off highway 401, and if you don't mind being quite far from downtown. There are fast food restaurants and a supermarket near by. The room is attractive and it is large and adequately clean, and it had a fridge (I don't think all the rooms do though). The room is quiet accept for some noise from the road (not too bad). I like the sleep number bed, it is a b it hard to learn how to control it but once you do you can make the bed firmer or softer and the pillows were pretty good. The bathroom seemed dated and in need of new caulking and improvement to the plumbing. There are two public computers with internet access in the lobby. And there is a sauna and small swimming pool that I never saw anyone using although it looks alright. The elevator and hallways needed sweeping and vaccuuming. However, the price is good, less than $100 per night in July. The desk staff were helpful and except for one of them they were friendly. If you stay there be sure to know the extra charges if you need to pay for parking or a rollaway bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay... Hats off to Sashi Srinivasan... and Mrs. Bosveski”
Reviews.Author: RAMSANR
Reviews.Content: Nice stay for a month.. with a good hospitable staff... very good breakfast... good pool and gym... overall a bonus to stay... sight of downtown is pretty good...!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: cubanito1
Reviews.Content: I just checked in on my 2nd visit to this fine hotel. I admit its not the Hyatt but for the money you get free internet, a pretty big room, parking is 5 bucks a night, and the staff was very pleasant. Its a short drive to Toronto about 12 minutes on the Don Valley, and there are lots o food options down the street alongside a Tim hortons and a Starbucks. I read some of the reviews and was skeptical, but for the money this hotel will get my business every time. When I checked in the room there it was a bit stuffy, but I opened the window and left it open my entire stay. Problem solved! Its also a safe hotel tucked right off the 401. I stayed facing the parking lot in room 627(first time) and 625 the second. Both rooms were super clean and the select comfort bed was awesome. I would recommended this hotel for travelers on a budget. I did get a better rate on the internet Hotels.com than asking the front desk clerk, even after I told him I would be back next week. Whatever! But its a good value, plus they have a pool, and an fitness room too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location outside downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Vancouvergoalie
Reviews.Content: We normally stay in the 4 stars and up in d/t but found that we always drove to Pacific Mall, Chinatown and Yorkdale. So we decided to find a place in between. I got this hotel on Priceline for $57 USD. Albeit it's not a 4 star, more like a 3 star but it's clean. Parking was only $5 per day. There's plenty of food places and plazas nearby. In fact, Pacific Mall/Markham Market is only about 10mins away, and Yorkdale more towards 15 mins. I only ventured to d/t Chinatown on the last day. There's free internet, and comp coffee in the lobby. The pool and exercise room are decent. Unfortunately, the hottub was not working during my stay. For those interested in deeper pools, this one goes to 8 ft deep. I'd definitely try staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reommended, especially if visiting the zoo”
Reviews.Author: PJ_Diddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a two week road trip around Ontario, we stayed here for 1 night in early August. We booked this due to proximity with Toronto Zoo and the fact you can buy a package with the tickets at discount price. They were very friendly at reception, we in fact checked in 2 hours early and were also upgraded to an executive room for free. No zoo vouchers were available at the time we checked in but we were told maintenance would drop some more off later, we picked them up in evening after dinner with no problems (easy to use at the zoo, just use them as a regular ticket and pay for your parking). The room was nice and clean, had a LCD TV, fridge, coffee maker, radio alarm and hairdryer for your use. The large room window had a view of Highway 401 with CN Tower in distance, there was no real noise despite the closeness. The hotel guests appeared to be mainly business people. Two PCs were in reception available for use for up to 30mins at a time and were fairly free most of the time. Parking was $5 per night with reasonable size car park directly in front of hotel, you just register your car details at reception, no need to use the meters. If visiting the zoo or a nearby conference then this hotel will suit you fine however it is a bit of a distance from downtown Toronto if you want to travel in.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Disturb means Please Disturb”
Reviews.Author: Crazy_Napoli
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel (Radisson Toronto East, 55 Hallcrown Place) because of its reasonable price combined with its high standard. I stayed in room 704 in this hotel for one month until 19 July 2009 together with my wife. The best thing about this hotel is its staff, the people. They are friendly, positive, helpful, smiling and efficient, on all levels from cleaners to the restaurant to the sales management, especially persons belonging to the so-called "visible minorities", as Canadian authorities like to define it. The room was large, clean and well presented, with a large double bed, office desk with a good office chair, very-noisy air conditioner, nice and large bathroom. The price was affordable, less than 100 CAD per day for the room (this was a special deal through an organization) incl. free high speed internet, a couple of bottles of fresh water every day and a TV with many Canadian and US channels. Large window opens a wide site of green horizon with often blue sky, so there is plenty of natural light in the room. The hotel has a small but practical swimming pool and a whirlpool (i.e. bubble-bath, spa, US: jacuzzi) which are clean and work well, and towels are provided. The same applies to the gym room. The hotel has a tradition of weekly reception with free food and wine for guests for meeting the management, pleasant and useful. The location of the hotel is probably most favorable for guests visiting the many business corporations in the area and the ACC (Armenian Community Centre). The hotel is located exactly beside the junction of Victoria Park Avenue and the important Highway 401 which connects the east with west of the country. There is practically nothing to do in the local area. The only place to go is the Fairview Shopping Centre at the Don Mills subway station ca. 30 min. walking from the hotel or a 10 min. walking and a 5 min. bus tour (2.5 CAD per person for that tour), which holds good standard with many shops but without a grocery. There is one middle quality grocery called Food Basics ca. 15 min. walking from the hotel, and a Chinese Market ca. 10 min. walking, but I think the latter may be suited for the specially interested, as the smell alone might drive you away if you try to shop the â€œusualâ€� daily food and other items there. There are several junk food outlets in the area ca. 10-15 min. walk from the hotel. A TTC bus (the public transport of Toronto) can take you to Toronto Zoo within ca. 30 min. from a bus stop at 10 min. walking distance from the hotel. It is also possible to order a bus tour to Niagara Falls by a direct pick-up and return at the hotel entrance, ask the reception about this. This tour arrangement called â€œC U Toursâ€� is great, but the driver is controlling the car only by one hand at high speed as his other hand is holding a microphone for various guiding stories most of the time, beware. To get to downtown one needs to walk ca. 10-15 min., than take a bus, than the subway, than change the subway later at the Sheppard station to Yonge line. The entire trip to downtown takes ca. 45 minutes, incl. the walking from the hotel. It costs 2.5 CAD per person per tour (i.e. one way). Remember to ask the driver of the bus for â€œtransfer ticketâ€� as it is the ticket you have to use later for your continuous journey in the subway as well. Similarly one must take a Transfer Ticket when entering the subway on the way from downtown to the hotel, as one has to use it after exiting the subway for taking bus no. 85, 85A, 85B, 85C, 85D, 24, 24A, 190 or 167 from Don Mills subway station to Victoria Park Avenue, from where one has to walk to the hotel. The bathroom had a leakage somewhere from the system, and the floor was flooded after each shower session. In our experience the worst thing in this hotel is its handling of the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign related to the management of their cleaning activities. Everyday a Housekeeping Department representative would call us up with a terribly loud telephone ringing, wake us up, and tell us that she had noticed the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign on our door, and that she needs to know if we need a service that day. At first we were shocked and terrified, but took it with comprehension. I spoke with the front desk staff, and they promised me that no one would ever wake us up again if we continue to hang the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign on the outside of our door. The next day the woman called us again. This terror continued every day, and made it impossible for us to sleep in peace even though we were setting out the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign. One Saturday they called us at 08:30. One Sunday they knocked the door to ask if we need a service on ca. 10:30 with the sign hanging out. I have spoken with the reception staff about 4 times about this, and every time they apologized and promised to talk the Housekeeping Manager to her senses. Nothing helped. After being terrorized for ca. 10 days I simply disconnected the two telephones in the room. This finally gave us an opportunity to sleep for few days. However, I needed to use the phone, and one day I connected it and forgot to disconnect after using. The next morning we were shocked up again by the Housekeeping who wanted to know why we have set out the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign, do we need service or not?! Once again I spoke with the front desk, and again they promised me that we will be left in peace in the future if we hang out the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign. The next morning the same nightmare continued. I got enough of this and once again disconnected the two phones in the room and never again used them during our stay. The last day of our stay I connected the phones before checking out, and saw the Message light blinking. I clicked the button and heard that the Housekeeping Manager had left many messages in the mornings asking us if we need service. I think the Housekeeping shall never disturb guests by knocking at the door or by calling them or in any other way, if the â€œDo Not Disturbâ€� sign is set out, and shall clean the room only after the sign is removed by the guest, at least this is my experience from the many European hotels I have used in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty with bugs”
Reviews.Author: shik92
Reviews.Content: First night we spent there, we were bitten by bed bugs. Carpeted floor had cookie or bread crumbs with other food stains. Bed sheets and towels also had some stains on them. We were also charged for parking, $5/night even thouth previous reviews indicated free parking. Yes, it was cheaper than any other hotels in the area. But if you really want to have a good night's rest in a clean room, I definitely vote against this one. Unless you don't mind sleeping with bed bugs. This was the worst three-star hotel experience ever. I don't understand how this hotel received the three-star rating. It was worse than two star hotels I have stayed in before.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Frandis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our way from Niagara to Montreal, we found the hotel to be very comfortable, the room was very spacious, clean and well appointed with desk and free wifi. Located next to the motorway with free parking. Only 5 minutes drive to metro which takes you to the city centre, has several pubs and eating places very close by. A great location if you do not want to be in the heart of the city especially if you are drving there. The staff very very helpful, courteous and efficent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, location & amenities. Best Value”
Reviews.Author: marykayHongKong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Excellent services with both front office and housekeeping. Dine in restaurant. Excellent value with what I pay for. Room is very clean, LCD TV, fridge in room, highspeed internet. Swimming pool, hot tub and fitness centre are excellent and complimentary for guest to use. Overall stay extreamly pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, website info WRONG”
Reviews.Author: lucy_2234
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend here because of a room sale on travelzoo, and let's just say I got what I paid for. The room itself was clean, but the carpets were very stained and could have used a good deep cleaning. Worst of all, despite the fact that the hotel's website advertises "highspeed wireless internet in all rooms," that is untrue - there is wired internet, but no wifi, so only one guest can use the internet at a time. As there were two of us with laptops trying to do some work, it was really inconvenient and very disappointing that the hotel's own website was wrong. Also, we were on a floor with a teenaged soccer team during the second night of our stay, so it wasn't very quiet. The best part of the stay was the price and the convenience of location, but I wouldn't go back there even if I paid less. There are other hotels in the area with much nicer rooms and better amenities for comparable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: brownman
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of itâ€™s proximity to the 401 and DVP-Don Valley Parkway. Great location and when you come to town from the west, you skip out on a lot of the traffic. There is ample parking and restaurants near by. We had to wait at the desk at check in as the service was quite slow and on check out, Zul was quick and efficient. I guess it depends who you get. We were located on the 8th floor and had a view of the parking lot :) The rooms were decent sizes and for the price ($79 with free internet) we couldn't go wrong. Before we entered the hallway, there was a huge stain on the carpet (looked like it was old) The elevators were a bit slow. A word of caution, don't pay of the internet. It's not wireless (I think only the lobby is wireless). I think dial-up would be faster. The hotel was totally booked but wasn't crowded or busy. Like someone else said, I didn't care for the sleep number bed and found the pillows had no support (ask for firm pillows) Overall a good stay and great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Exterior but looks can be deceiving! Rooms are Great!”
Reviews.Author: CNDTRVLR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel over the Holdiay weekend in August for 2 nights. Payed around $100/night. We stayed in Rm 822 and our family in Rm 825. PRO's : I'm Impressed. Rooms were nice, clean and updated! Nice sized rooms. Flat screen T'V's. Good housekeeping services. You could tell the rooms were remodled. Bathrooms a bit small but in good conditon. Even had a scale in the bathroom. King size bed was nice. Sheets seemed clean. Overall the Rooms were very nice. Houskeeping did a great job. Toiletries were refilled as well as towels everyday. Front desk staff were very nice as well. Con's: Sleep number bed. I did not care for this bed's feature's but it was comfortable when deflated. The controller for the bed did not display anything. Too nosiy when you inflate it too make the bed more firm. The pool was on the small side. No towels in the pool area but it was rectified upon mentioning it to front desk staff. Hot tub was nothing special but adequate. One complaint is about the pet policy. I sent an email 2 weeks ahead of time to the email listed on the local hotel website reguarding some more detailed information about pets. I received no response. The hotel website states it accept's pets but failes to give any further information whether there is a charge for pets etc . We brought our small puppy which was less than 5lbs with us on the trip without knowing if it would cost us anything additional. When checking in I inquired about my pet staying and was told it was an extra $30/night . This is riddiculous! I just ended up having the pup stay with family in the area. I think the hotel should updated its website to show rates/charges for pets staying at the hotel and more detailed information reguarding it's pet policy. Hotel is located right beside the 401. So my room # 822 was facing the 401 and was a bit noisy but not bad considering. I still had a good nights sleep. The view was not bad either. You could see the CN tower and downtown T.O in the distance. My relatives stayed in room #825 and it faced the front of the hotel or the business park and parking lot. Overall I was very impressed with this hotel and would stay there again. It was reasonably priced and the rooms were great! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kashy
Reviews.Content: As a Director of a global company I travel extensively around the globe and I tend to stay in hotels that have a nice bathroom, great bed, clean surroundings and all the amenties that add that little touch that I miss being away from home. My company has a large global client based in Toronto and I am responsible for that client which has led me to visit Toronto frequently. I first came to the Radisson Toronto East accidently but the hotel is so comfortable in every way that I would usually assess during my travels that now my choice of stay by default is the Radisson Toronto East. The rooms in the hotel are spacious, the bed is simply fantastic with electrical pressure controls which helps me sleep well. The bathroom is equally good and the place is well fitted out with free internet access and free parking. I have now made this hotel a place I stay at out of choice. I would recommend anyone visiting or travelling to Toronto to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTrainer
Reviews.Content: The Radisson's manager helped me out of a major bind. I had 13 people travel into Toronto for a conference and the other hotel I had booked them into in a word - "STUNK". They demanded (rightly) a new hotel. However it was already 4pm and I had to find 13 rooms in a flash. I called the Radisson. The Radisson not only put all their staff into gear getting me 13 rooms ready within 1/2 hour of my phone call, but paid special attention to my staff due to the difficulties they had experienced at the other hotel. Each one of them expressed how friendly and attentive the staff at the Radisson were to them, not to mention the cleanliness and beauty of the rooms they were assigned. The Radisson got me out of a sticky mess and I will remember that every time I schedule a group for a conference again. I would recommend the Radisson Toronto East to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson is so-so”
Reviews.Author: rodyk
Reviews.Content: This place was just so-so. I probably would have rated it 2 stars instead of 3 stars if it weren't for the sleep number beds. That was a cool feature. It's not in the nicest neighborhood and the free parking lot is loaded with signage warning you that it's not the hotel's problem if your car gets broken into. I chose this area since it's halfway between Toronto and Canada's Wonderland. That would have worked out well if it weren't for Toronto's horrendous traffic, especially on the 401. The in-house restaurant was another positive. Very good food, although a little pricey. Refrigerators are on-request only. I requested one a month early when I made my reservation, but was told at check in that was no guarantee and that housekeeping was in charge of them. Needless to say there was no fridge in the room and none available. One was finally delivered on the third day of our 3-night stay. Very disappointing. The indoor pool was nice and clean, as were the rooms overall. If I had to do it over again, I'd probably try a different hotel. There was nothing terribly wrong or right with this hotel, it was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Umnh, yuck”
Reviews.Author: TBird1976
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd be staying in a quality room at a reputable hotel. It ended up I was terrified of catching some kind of disease. The 1st room we were sent to hadn't even been made up yet, and it was 6pm. We opened the door to one foul mess. Visited the front desk and barely got an apology. Were reassigned to another room, which to my dismay, wasn't in much better shape. The rug felt sticky and was horribly stained, the towels and cloths looked like they hadn't been washed. I was uncomfortable with the idea of sleeping in the beds for fear of aforementioned disease. And the number system thing really did feel like an air mattress. I was happy to check-out as quickly as possible and am even happier at the prospect that I never will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised; we'll return here!”
Reviews.Author: honu734
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel based on its location. I was really surprised at how nice the hotel room was. All of the beds are sleep number beds. The bed was huge and in great shape! I think we got an executive room with an extra large business desk, flat screen tv, space to spread out all of our stuff. The furnishings were really beautiful. It would have felt like the Hilton except for the smaller-than-life bathroom (which made it difficult for both my husband and I to get ready in the morning at the same time). But the room was large and spacious. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel at all. I know for a fact that we will return to this hotel many times in the future. Our room was on the 8th floor and was wonderful. No noise from neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a ton and you'll be fine”
Reviews.Author: Montyaloofah
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute trip to Toronto and needed a place to stay. I used Priceline and was successful at the Radisson Toronto East. It was ~25minutes travelling from Toronto Pearson Airport. Arrived to find free parking which is a nice treat. Lobby are was small but functional. There were 2 computers with internet access available for guest use. There were also a lot of small cards with local attractions. Checking in was very smooth. I was given my requested room with 2 queen beds. We were given a fifth floor room with a view of the highway. Beds were both sleep number type beds. The bedding was comfortable and the pillows were soft. The room was clean but the carpet did have a few stains. No problem for me... There was also a small microwave and refridgerator in the room. That was a nice touch. Wired internet in the rooms is complimentary. It would have been great if it worked consistently. The signal was on and off the entire time. Very annoying. The bathroom is small but fine. Bath products were average. Water pressure on the shower was very weak. Service was fine. I had to call the front desk a few times about problems in the room and they were prompt to send someone over to fix it. I didn't use the pool or gym but i did take a look. Both were very small. The gym machines were old and space was limited. Overall, i was fine with my stay. Considering how much i paid, i couldn't complain. If you don't mind staying a few minutes away from downtown, this is not a bad place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Way Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: dcdriver
Reviews.Content: Gave a bid on Priceline and this is the hotel we got (for a great price). I was more than a bit concerned considering the lukewarm previous reviews but we were very pleasantly surprised. Stayed there 2 nights in July as a base for Niagara Falls and some Toronto touring and we thought this hotel got a bum deal from other reviewers. It's a bit far out (though we did want the general area), but it's right on the 401, which makes it a quick drive to everywhere. Free parking makes up for the left-field location. The room was big (no view to speak of), nicely furnished, and the bed was super-comfortable. The shower was terrific, too. Air-conditioning was a tad noisy but cooled nicely (it was broiling outside) and the mini-fridge also worked well. The staff was polite and professional (which is all I want from hotel staff). Didn't try any of the restaurants but I would totally recommend this hotel and we'd go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there if you are expecting something more than 2 star”
Reviews.Author: Fussy-Honest
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed in 4 different hotels in Toronto from 26 May to 2 June 2007, and Radisson is amongst them. I have read all reviews on this hotel in this side, and most of them are 90% correct. One comment from my side that this hotel is a 2 star hotel & if you are OK with 2 star hospitality, then go for it! You wouldn't regret! And of course if you have a car, and free to park!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Orillia1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an extended weekend to meet family from all over the province. Pool area was great. Food at the restaurant was well prepared, fast and well priced. Rooms were large, beds comfortable and we were close to most things that we wanted to see. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Overal great time spent at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: This was an average to below average Radisson. Rates were cheap, but they internet connections in the rooms (tried 2 different rooms) was so slow the computer was unusable. WiFi only in the lobby. So I checked out. Staff was great, hotel could use a little attention to the amenities.... If your on businsess and want to use the computer, seek an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: rebel1
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights at the Radisson and was delighted with this hotel. We were looking just for a place to crash after shopping and this hotel was great. The room was very spacious and clean for this type of hotel. I am used to staying a 5-star hotels in downtown Toronto (Sutton Place, King Edward, Westin Harbour, Royal York, etc). While the Radisson is not in the same league, it is better than what I expected and in some aspects were better than the 5-stars. The spaciousness was a plus...room had a king bed, desk and chair, sofa chair and ottoman. Washroom was average size...not huge but big enough to move around without rubbing up on the counter, tub, or toilet. The bed was a Sleep Number bed...where you could adjust each side independently with a remote to control the softness/firmness. Nice touch...I don't think I'd ever buy a bed like that but I've stayed in 5-star hotels where the mattresses were horrible. The Sleep number was reasonably comfortable and a nice surprise (I still prefer our pocket-coil bed at home). Parking was an open lot in front of the hotel. Lots of space. Not covered parking but also no added charge (unlike the downtown 5-stars) for parking. We took the advice of others on this site and requested a room facing the parking lot and not the highway so we never heard any traffic noise. We did not use the restaurant or amenities so we cannot rates those. We had no problems with the front desk staff...check in and out was quick and easy. Overall, an excellent hotel for the money. Great place to stay if you are not looking to spend a lot of time playing in the hotel. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: mangie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Radisson Hotel Toronto East. After spending all day at Canada's Wonderland, we checked in late to the hotel. Check in was fast & the front desk staff was very friendly & helpful. Our room was large & very clean. The king size bed was so comfortable, just what we needed after a long tired day at Wonderland. The bathroom was also very clean, nice toiletries & the shower had good water pressure. The room was so quiet, couldn't hear anything from our 5th floor room, courtyard side. The continental breakfast was a great bonus. Good buffet selection of hot & cold items such as cereal, fruit, muffins, eggs, sausage, home fries, french toast, bacon, pancakes, ham and all the other usual buffet items. Food was quite tasty, no complaints. The free parking at the hotel was also a nice bonus. Only a 10 minute drive downtown, very convenient. The hotel was a great location for us, right between Canada's Wonderland & downtown. The value for your money can't be beat. I definitely recommend this hotel & would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We all loved the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: spannerbabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson for 11 days and thought it was great, the staff were wonderful. Having never been to Canada before Zul, and Cheral on the front desk were the best, they told us the where to get the tube, to different places to go. Food was resonable priced and ate there often. Our room was large with very comfortable beds, am going back to Canada next year and will be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “I am giving it 1 because your site does not allow zero”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So I called the hotel and made a reservation for a non-smoking suite with two beds, baby crib and Refrigerators. I arrive to the hotel at midnight they have a smoking suite with one bed, no crib or Refrigerators. When I complained to the night shift manager he tried to tell me that the suite was non-smoking. I asked him to explain tome why there are ash trays and matches in in the rooms! They tolled me they do not have a crib or refrigerator available for the night but they will have it in the morning, I was there for 6 days and never saw either one. I asked them for another bed because one bed was not enough for my wife and my two children, they brought us a roll-away bed to the room. It was so filthy that we did not use it. Room was so dirty there were chunks of food stuck to the carpet. 2 AM I decided I am here for vacation and will not put up with this. They moved us, actually they just gave us a cart and I moved everything, to a new room. This one was not as filthy as the other one. I stayed at this hotel for 6 days. One day all 3 elevators worked, 3 days two elevators worked and 2 days only one. These people are in the wrong business they have no concept of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the parking lot side!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's a decent hotel. The rooms are roomy, decent desk and chair, a window that opens, free high speed internet, and a reasonable tv. Don't expect a Fairmont, and you'll be fine. I have stayed at other hotels in this immediate area, and this is as good as you'll get here. The 401 highway is a bit on the noisy side. Ask for a room on the reception side of the hotel. As with most suburban hotels, the restaurant is mediocre. Unfortunately, so are many of the restaurants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria Day weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the Victoria Day weekend. Location wise, the hotel is adjacent to the 401 and about 5 minute walk from the #85 Sheppard Bus which takes you to the Don Mills subway stop (about 5 minute bus ride). The room was clean and spacious and the bed was quite comfortable. Since the hotel is located in a suburban business park, I would recommend that if you do stay here, have a vehicle at your disposal. The service was on the brisk and not so friendly during both check-in and check-out; though it was prompt. The housekeeping staff would tend to enter your room without first knocking; which happened to me. So, I recommend using all the locks on your room door!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Awsome everytime”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, large rooms with large windows and nice furniture. The pool area looked like it was from the 70's. But everything else is great. The staff is very nice too. This hotels seems alot nicer then other 3-star hotels. Other reviewers said it seemed worn out in places, but it must have been recently renovated, becuase this was definately not the case.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: philFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel on a number of occasions over the years, starting in the late '70s when it was a Travelodge. I've always considered it to be a good value. It's clean and comfortable. It's not 5-star luxury, but then the rooms don't go for a 5-star price. It's located near Victoria Park and Hwy 401. If you have business in the west-Scarborough or east-North York areas of Toronto, it's a great choice, particularly if you're approaching Toronto from the east along the 401 (e.g., from Kingston or Ottawa). There are a number of suburban shopping malls in the vicinity of the hotel, most with restaurants. Beyond that, there are few attractions in the area. The Victoria Park subway station is about 10km south, which is your gateway to all Toronto has to offer. Parking is available at the subway station. Also, because the hotel is so close to Hwy 401, it's also easy to drive downtown via the Don Valley Parkway (just a few kilometers west of Victoria Park).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August for two days and had a very nice experience. Rooms are very spacious, hotel staff very professional and helpful and the hotel itself very clean. The hotel is a little worn out in spaces, especially the carpets but as mentioned, very clean. Also, the hotel was a little out of the way, in the suburbs, but there were restaurants very close to the area and there was 24 hour bus service, albeit to get to downtown Toronto, it took about 45 minutes. Also, the hotel has free parking and close to major highways. Overall, a pleasant experience and would recommend to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible hotel I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Noise from the trucks on the highway all night long, damaged hairdryer....

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel Toronto East
HotelInfo.Address: 55 Hallcrown Place, Toronto, Ontario M2J 4R1, Canada
